treatment.description: Plants 15–40 cm, glabrate or sparsely villous, densely stipitate-glandular. Leaves: basal blades lanceolate, 40–80(–160) × 10–30 mm, margins coarsely toothed to biserrate, faces villous to tomentose. Heads 3–6. Involucres 7–11 × 8–15 mm. Phyllaries loose, subequal, green throughout. 2n = 12.
treatment.habitat: forest openings in pine and mixed hardwoods forests
treatment.discussion: Variety hirta intergrades with var. sonchifolia in the northern part of its range.
